The electric autorickshaws will serve as mobile platforms for spreading awareness about the ban on plastic items like earbuds, balloon sticks, and utensils, which was implemented in January 2019. The project aims to empower women while simultaneously promoting environmental consciousness within the state.

title: Congress Rejects Anvar's Demands in Kerala By-elections
news:
The Congress party in Kerala has firmly rejected demands from dissident LDF MLA P.V. Anvar, who is seeking support for the November 13 by-elections. Anvar had demanded the Congress withdraw its candidate, Ramya Haridas, in the Chelakkara Assembly constituency.

Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan stated that Anvar's request is unacceptable. He emphasized that the Congress will not engage in dialogue with Anvar based on this demand. Satheesan further stated that Anvar's candidates would not impact the UDF's electoral prospects. 

He also dismissed Anvar's request to field Youth Congress State President Rahul Mamkootathil as an independent candidate. Mamkootathil is already contesting as the UDF candidate. 

Following Satheesan's comments, Anvar appealed on Facebook for voters to support the Democratic Movement of Kerala's independent candidate, N.K. Sudheer, in Chelakkara. He urged voters to choose Sudheer to protect Kerala from a perceived political nexus between the UDF, LDF, and BJP.

title: 12 Arrested in Immoral Trafficking Bust Near Aluva
news:
On Sunday, Ernakulam Rural police apprehended 12 individuals, including seven women and five men, from a lodge in Paravur Kavala near Aluva on charges of immoral trafficking. 

The raid, which lasted for six hours, was conducted following a tip-off provided to District Police Chief (Ernakulam Rural) Vaibhav Saxena. 

Among those arrested are Nibin, the lodge owner from Aluva, Amal from Vembayam, and Sunitha from North Paravur. They have been remanded in custody. Two individuals suspected of acting as agents, recruiting clients through online and mobile platforms, were also apprehended. 

Police revealed that the women allegedly involved were from Alappuzha, Kollam, Thiruvananthapuram, and Wayanad districts. The racket reportedly operated by renting rooms in the lodge for extended periods to facilitate the illicit activities. 

The police investigation is ongoing.

title: Flying Beast Denies Divorce Rumors, Calls Them "PR Activity"
news:
Popular YouTuber Gaurav Taneja, known as Flying Beast, has addressed recent divorce rumors circulating online. He refuted these claims in a 20-minute video, calling them a "PR activity," but acknowledged that many people were sharing stories about the alleged separation. 

Taneja explained that rumors started circulating after his wife Ritu Rathee was seen consulting spiritual guru Premanand Govind Sharan. He clarified that Rathee had requested a private session and asked for her face to be concealed in any recordings. 

Despite their efforts to remain private, Rathee was unintentionally featured in one of the videos, sparking speculation. 

In the video, Taneja said, "We decided to stay silent because we did nothing wrong and have nothing to fear." 

The couple has been facing online negativity, with some accusing Taneja of cheating and abandoning Rathee and their children. Taneja stated that these claims were false and that he had documented his family trip together to dispel the rumors. 

Taneja concluded his message by saying, "This is for those who truly care about us. We are not here to sway anyone's opinion – everyone is entitled to their own views, and we fully respect that."

title: Climate Activist Sonam Wangchuk Ends Hunger Strike After Centre's Invite for Talks
news:
Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk and other civil society leaders from Ladakh have ended their 16-day hunger strike after the Union Ministry of Home Affairs invited them for talks. The Ministry has agreed to convene a meeting of the high-powered committee (HPC) led by Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai on December 3. The HPC will discuss the four-point agenda put forward by the Leh Apex Body (LAB) and the Kargil Democratic Alliance (KDA), which includes demands for statehood, tribal status, employment opportunities, and a dedicated Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha seat for each region. 

Wangchuk, who initiated the hunger strike to facilitate talks between the civil society leaders and the government, expressed his hope for a positive outcome in the upcoming discussions. He stressed that the focus should be on environmental degradation, with the region facing rapid glacier melting and facing threats from neighboring countries. 

Protesters highlighted the unique culture and identity of Ladakh, emphasizing the need for the recognition of their tribal status and the importance of securing employment opportunities for the local population. The HPC was first constituted in January 2023 and has been tasked with addressing key issues concerning Ladakh's culture, environment, employment, and constitutional safeguards.

title: Munnar Resort Fined for Dumping Waste on Elephant Path
news:
The Chinnakkanal grama panchayat in Idukki, Kerala, has identified and fined a private resort, "The Wind Munnar," for illegally dumping waste on an elephant path, a recent incident that garnered attention after wild tusker Arikompan was captured in the area. 

The panchayat responded swiftly after The Hindu reported on the incident on October 20th. Officials found large amounts of plastic waste and broken glass on the elephant route, posing a serious threat to the animals that frequent the area. 

The resort owner had outsourced waste disposal but the contractors abandoned the waste on the elephant path after an attempt to burn it failed due to heavy rain.  This irresponsible act led to the dangerous situation and the panchayat has taken steps to penalize the resort.

As part of its ongoing efforts to create a waste-free environment in Chinnakkanal, a major tourist hotspot, the panchayat is installing 30 AI cameras with the support of local resorts. The cameras will help identify and deter future instances of illegal waste dumping.

title: 'Made of Chennai Kolu Kondattam 2024' Contest Winners Felicitated
news:
The 'Made of Chennai Kolu Kondattam 2024' contest, organized by The Hindu Downtown, concluded on October 20th with a ceremony to honor the winners. Held between October 3rd and 7th, the contest attracted numerous entries, with three winners and ten consolation prize winners being chosen from each edition of the hyperlocal supplement. 

The event featured captivating dance performances by students of Kalaimamani Srimathi and Anitha Guha, entertaining the audience. 

Notable dignitaries, including Y. V. Niranjan (Managing Director of Gopuram Products), K.S. Natrajan (Principal of Saraswathi Vidyalaya Senior Secondary School), M. Kumaravelan (Managing Director of Madras Coffee House), and Rithi Sakthi (Proprietrix of Amman Sarees), presented awards to the winners. 

The contest was sponsored by Gopuram Products and co-sponsored by ITC Mangaldeep. It received support from numerous associate partners, including Aroma ghee, Rajamanickam Mudaliyar Company, Aachi Masala, Medimix, NAGA Products, and many more. The event's food partner was Madras Coffee House, and the education partner was Saraswathi Vidyalaya Senior Secondary School.

title: Tamil Nadu Police Commemorate Fallen Officers
news:
On Monday, October 21st, the Tamil Nadu Police observed Police Commemoration Day, honoring officers who lost their lives in the line of duty. The event was led by Director-General of Police (DGP) Shankar Jiwal, who joined police personnel, defense staff, and retired officers in paying tribute. 

The day commemorates the sacrifice of ten Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel killed in an ambush by Chinese troops in Ladakh in 1959.  This year, the remembrance also honored 213 police officers and personnel who died nationwide in 2023.

Among those remembered from the Tamil Nadu Police were Special Sub-Inspector of Police K. Pushparaj (Virudhunagar District), Head Constable Kumaran (Avadi City), and Grade I Constables M. Karthikeyan (Virudhunagar District), P. Vignesh (Namakkal District), and S. Jesus Alwin (Thoothukudi District). 

The ceremony included participation from former National Security Advisor M.K. Narayanan, retired DGPs, representatives of the Army, Navy, Air Force, and Coast Guard, Chennai District Collector Rashmi Siddharth Jagade, and family members of the fallen officers.

title: Indian Tobacco Farmers Reap Record Profits Thanks to Global Demand
news:
Indian farmers in Andhra Pradesh have seen a record-breaking year for Flue-Cured Virginia (FCV) tobacco, with both production and prices reaching new highs.  The 2023-24 crop season yielded a total of 215.35 million kilograms of FCV tobacco, selling for an average price of ₹288.65 per kilogram, a 26% increase over the previous year. 

This success story can be attributed to strong international demand for Indian FCV tobacco, which has boosted farmer revenue and contributed to the national exchequer through export earnings.  The Tobacco Board of India, which oversees the industry, facilitated the sale of the crop through 16 auction platforms across Andhra Pradesh, engaging over 43,000 growers.

The board also waived penalties for farmers who sold excess tobacco, resulting in a benefit of ₹184 crore for growers.  While the overall export figure for the 2023-24 season hit a record ₹12,005 crore, estimates indicate that the 2024-25 season will surpass this mark, with exports already reaching ₹8,243.58 crore by September. 

The Tobacco Board is also contributing to flood relief efforts in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, with farmers and employees collecting ₹92.70 lakh to be donated to the Chief Minister’s Relief Fund.

title: Three VMC Corporators Switch Allegiances, Joining TDP Amidst Flood Relief Praise
news:
Three Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) corporators have joined the Telugu Desam Party (TDP), along with several other leaders from the YSR Congress Party (YSRCP). This move comes amidst praise for TDP Chief N. Chandrababu Naidu's leadership during the recent floods in Vijayawada. 

TDP MP Kesineni Sivanath, who welcomed the defectors, cited Naidu's effective relief and rescue efforts as a key factor attracting YSRCP leaders. Sivanath also emphasized the public's desire for a change from the perceived "dictatorial rule" of Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy. 

Bonda Umamaheswara Rao, the Vijayawada Central MLA, echoed these sentiments, highlighting Naidu's dedication to flood-affected citizens and his overall progress in leading the state. The influx of YSRCP members to the TDP signals a potential shift in political dynamics in the region, with the upcoming elections likely to be influenced by these developments.

title: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister to Visit Namakkal Today
news:
Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will visit Namakkal, Tamil Nadu on October 22nd, 2024. His visit will include unveiling a statue of former Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi at Selamba Gounder Park and attending a government function at Bommakuttaimedu.

The government function will see the inauguration of completed projects, the laying of foundation stones for new projects worth ₹810.28 crore, and the distribution of welfare assistance to 16,000 beneficiaries. Stalin will also deliver a speech to the attendees.

The event will be attended by ministers, MPs, MLAs, and elected members of local bodies. Stalin will travel to Tiruchirappalli after the event and return to Chennai by flight in the evening. 

The venue at Bommakuttaimedu and the Doctor Kalaignar Centenary Bus Stand were inspected by officials on October 21st, 2024, to ensure arrangements are in place for the Chief Minister's visit.

title: Telangana's GST Collections Plummet: KTR Blames Congress Policies
news:
Telangana's working president, K.T. Rama Rao, has blamed the Congress government's policies for a dramatic decline in GST collections. According to Rao, GST collections have fallen to less than 1% year-over-year growth for the first time, a significant drop from the 15% annual growth achieved during the BRS rule. 

Rao criticized the Congress government's policies, particularly their alleged emulation of a "bulldozer raj," claiming they have had a devastating impact on the economy. He also pointed out that Telangana's GST collections now rival Uttar Pradesh's, highlighting a substantial economic downturn. 

Rao further stated that the only sector thriving under the current government is liquor sales, which he believes is a reflection of their misguided policies. He challenged the Chief Minister to explain the drastic economic decline, highlighting the "special talent" required to dismantle Telangana's once thriving economy.

title: Jharkhand Gets New DGP: Ajay Kumar Singh Appointed
news:
The Election Commission of India (ECI) has approved the appointment of Ajay Kumar Singh as the new Director General of Police (DGP) of Jharkhand. Singh, a 1989 batch Indian Police Service (IPS) officer, is the senior most officer in the cadre.

The appointment follows the ECI's order to remove acting DGP Anurag Gupta on October 19th, citing his "history of election-related misconduct in previous elections." Gupta, a 1990-batch IPS officer, had been appointed DGP in July, replacing Singh who had held the position since February 2023. 

Singh was chosen from a panel of three IPS officers submitted by the Jharkhand government after the ECI's directive. 

The appointment comes ahead of the upcoming Jharkhand Assembly elections, scheduled for November 13th and 20th. The counting of votes will take place on November 23rd.

title: Tirupati Police Enhance Traffic Control with High-Tech Two-Wheelers
news:
The Tirupati police have inaugurated 17 specially designed two-wheelers equipped with advanced technology to improve traffic management in the city. The vehicles, unveiled on Monday by Collector Venkateswar and SP L. Subbarayudu, feature GPS, sirens, public addressing systems, flashlights, and breathalyzers. 

These vehicles will be deployed across seven sectors of the city, allowing traffic police to respond swiftly and effectively. The technology allows for real-time monitoring of traffic flow and the capture of images of vehicles causing traffic disruptions. Offenders will be identified and fined.

The initiative aims to tackle issues such as one-way road violations, footpath encroachments, and improper parking. The police also hope to utilize the new vehicles to raise public awareness about traffic rules and reduce road accidents. Breathalyzers will be used to deter drunk driving. 

The deployment of these high-tech two-wheelers marks a significant step in the Tirupati police’s efforts to modernize traffic management and ensure smoother, safer roads for all.

title: Kerala HC Dismisses Appeal by Former IPS Officer Siby Mathews
news:
The Kerala High Court has dismissed an appeal filed by former IPS officer Siby Mathews challenging a single judge's order to register an FIR against him. Mathews is accused of revealing the identity of the survivor in the Suryanelli rape case in a book he wrote. 

The single judge had ruled that there was a prima facie case against Mathews, citing his inclusion of details about the survivor's parents in his book, which is considered a violation of Section 228A of the Indian Penal Code. 

While upholding the order, the Division Bench clarified that its decision would not affect any future actions taken by Mathews regarding the FIR. The court also confirmed the stay on the single judge's observation regarding the prima facie case. 

The appeal was filed by Mathews in response to a petition filed by K.K. Joshwa, a former police officer, who alleged that Mathews' actions constituted a violation of the survivor's right to privacy.

title: Air India Revamps Fare Structure, Introducing Eight New Categories
news:
Following the recent passing of Ratan Tata, the Tata Group's Air India has announced a major restructuring of its fare system, introducing eight new categories across Economy, Premium Economy, Business, and First Class. This new structure, which took effect on October 17th, allows passengers to choose from a range of options based on their specific needs and budgets.

The "one-size-fits-all" approach is deemed "increasingly redundant," according to Air India.  The new fare families offer diverse benefits like enhanced luggage allowance, flexible cancellation and date-change options, and are available for all domestic and international flights, including destinations like the UAE.

In Economy, passengers can select from Value, Classic, and Flex fares, while similar options are available in Premium Economy, Business, and First Class.  The "value" fare offers flexibility and one piece of checked baggage, ideal for budget-conscious travellers.  The "classic" and "flex" fares provide more flexibility and increased luggage allowance for those seeking a more premium experience.

The airline also updated pricing categories for flights to Europe and the UK, offering more economical options, including a single checked bag up to 23 kg. 

This fare restructuring is part of Air India's ongoing five-year reformation journey, "Vihaan.AI," aimed at boosting operational productivity and enhancing customer experience.  The airline is also undertaking an ambitious fleet expansion, with a recent order for 85 new Airbus planes, as well as plans to add more Boeing aircraft to its fleet.

title: AI-Powered Contract Management: A Game-Changer for India's Business Landscape
news:
As India's business environment becomes increasingly dynamic and globalized, contract management is rising to become a crucial factor for operational efficiency and legal compliance. However, traditional methods of contract management are struggling to meet the demands for speed, transparency, and scalability. This is where AI-powered contract management steps in, poised to revolutionize the Indian business landscape.

**The Current Landscape:**

Currently, contract management in India is largely fragmented and reliant on paper-based processes. This leads to costly burdens, increased compliance risks, and limited strategic potential.  The rise of digital platforms and electronic signatures is changing the game, with businesses embracing cloud-based solutions and CLM (Contract Lifecycle Management) platforms.

**Key Trends Shaping the Future:**

* **Cloud-Based Digitization & Automation:**  Cloud-based CLM platforms offer a centralized hub for teams to collaborate and manage contracts efficiently.  These platforms integrate data from different systems, streamlining processes and simplifying version control.
* **AI-Enhanced Analytics:** AI-powered tools, especially those using Natural Language Processing (NLP), are being used to interpret contracts, extract key information, and identify potential risks.  This allows contract managers to make informed decisions and mitigate risks.
* **Digital Smart Contracts:** Smart contracts, fueled by AI and cloud technologies, will offer businesses greater functionality and automation, reducing the time needed for contract review and management.

**Benefits of AI-Powered Contract Management:**

* **Streamlined Processes:**  Automated tasks and improved data management lead to increased efficiency and reduced administrative burdens.
* **Reduced Risks:** AI-powered analysis helps identify potential risks early on, allowing businesses to take proactive measures and ensure compliance.
* **Enhanced Transparency:**  Digital platforms provide greater transparency and visibility into contracts, improving collaboration and communication.

**Conclusion:**

The future of contract management in India looks bright, with AI-powered solutions leading the way. Businesses that embrace these digital solutions will gain a significant competitive advantage, reaping the benefits of streamlined processes, reduced risks, and enhanced transparency. By leveraging the power of AI, businesses can navigate the complexities of the legal and regulatory landscape, driving growth and ensuring success in the years to come.

title: Nilgiris Butterfly Experts Discover Host Plant of Endemic Species
news:
Butterfly enthusiasts in the Nilgiris have made a significant discovery: the Nilgiri tit butterfly (Hypolycaena nilgirica) uses a large terrestrial orchid plant, *Eulophia epidendraea*, as a host. This is the first recorded instance of this species utilizing this specific plant in India. 

The study, published in the scientific journal "The Tropical Lepidoptera," was conducted by Manoj Sethumadhavan, Felix Nirmal Dev, Vinod Sriramulu, and Selvaraj Jeevith near the Kallar horticultural garden. The discovery holds immense importance for the conservation of this rare, endemic butterfly, classified under Schedule II of the Wildlife Protection Act.

Previously, the Nilgiri tit was known to exist in the Nilgiris and Sri Lanka.  While sightings were recorded in various parts of the Western Ghats, this recent discovery sheds light on the butterfly's specific habitat preferences and reproductive behavior.

The researchers observed that the Nilgiri tit lays its eggs on the inflorescence of the *Eulophia epidendraea*, indicating a strong connection between the butterfly and this particular orchid species. Further research is anticipated to better understand the life cycle of this unique species, as well as its relationship with the surrounding flora and fauna.

title: Telangana and India Spar Over Unfulfilled Promises
news:
A decade after the formation of Telangana, the Union Home Ministry is calling for a meeting with the state's Chief Secretary to discuss the implementation of educational and infrastructure projects promised under the Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act (APRA) of 2014. 

The meeting comes amidst growing frustration in Telangana regarding the lack of progress on several key projects outlined in Schedule XIII of the APRA. The central government's commitments include establishing a Tribal University and a Horticulture University, studying the feasibility of an integrated steel plant in Khammam district, and improving road connectivity in the state's backward regions.

However, the progress on these projects has been slow, with several facing delays or outright cancellations. The proposed steel plant has been shelved due to economic viability concerns. The rail coach factory has been scaled down to a periodical overhauling workshop despite repeated requests from the state government. 

The situation regarding the Tribal University is particularly concerning. While a gazette notification was issued in December 2023, nine and a half years after the assurance was made, there is no guarantee on the funding allocated for the university. In contrast, the central government has already released ₹400 crore of the ₹825 crore sanctioned for a similar university in Andhra Pradesh. 

The meeting, which will be chaired by the Union Home Secretary, will be attended by secretaries of key ministries including Higher Education, Agriculture, Steel, Coal and Power. This meeting is crucial to bridge the gap between promises made and actions taken, and address the concerns raised by Telangana.

title: Rela Hospital Successfully Performs Lung Transplant on 18-Year-Old Girl
news:
Rela Hospital in Chennai has successfully performed a bilateral lung transplant on an 18-year-old girl named Shanmugapriya. The patient, from Thoothukudi, was suffering from post-tuberculosis bilateral bronchiectasis, a condition that severely damages the lungs following a TB infection.

Shanmugapriya contracted tuberculosis at the age of eight, leading to a prolonged struggle with respiratory issues. Her condition worsened, requiring constant oxygen support at home, which increased from 2 liters to 15 liters per day over time. 

The healthy lungs were harvested from a brain-dead donor in Thanjavur and transported to Rela Hospital within two hours and twenty minutes. The transplant surgery, led by Dr. Srinath Vijayasekaran, director of Cardiothoracic Surgery and Heart and Lung Transplantation, lasted approximately four hours.

Mohamed Rela, Chairman and Managing Director of Rela Hospital, praised the multidisciplinary team's efforts and expressed gratitude to the donor and the Tamil Nadu government. Shanmugapriya, after spending a week in the ICU and two weeks in the general ward, is currently recovering.
